document.title: Archdiocese of Milwaukee Curriculum Guide, Grade 4

F5B3405B469F47089C73CDFBE333AC8D.description: Generate a number or shape pattern that follows a given rule

CCFE28F74BBF4FE8B67E66DDD771E3BA.description: Analyze a pattern to determine features not apparent in the rule

C9857A6E1B964214873F1BC029FA1727.description: Identify a number or shape pattern

E97BFA04D6F44F5DA50BB0D914249FE0.description: Generate a number or shape pattern that follows a given rule. Identify apparent features of the pattern that were not explicit in the rule itself. For example, given the rule "Add 3" and the starting number 1, generate terms in the resulting sequence and observe that the terms appear to alternate between odd and even numbers. Explain informally why the numbers will continue to alternate in this way.

CD77C2FFDB6A4AB58F393B20E40F9FCB.description: Evaluate if a given whole number (1-100) is a prime or composite

D43D5FB43A2F4861B995D62B8CC6A59D.description: Determine if a given whole number (1-100) is a multiple of a given one-digit number

72AA950AE07F4E139A02298E8C3B52BF.description: Recognize that a whole number is a multiple of each of its factors

740B2C7462384A84A9D040F9BC8BABEA.description: Identify all factor pairs for any given number 1-100

C7572E94C10A435CA6BB3E7C991CF918.description: Know strategies to determine whether a whole number is prime or composite

386A605EE95C476786F029ECFF90BD5E.description: Find all factor pairs for a whole number in the range 1-100. Recognize that a whole number is a multiple of each of its factors. Determine whether a given whole number in the range 1-100 is a multiple of a given one-digit number. Determine whether a given whole number in the range 1-100 is prime or composite.

7E73A23F9B0049C79918E5ED69E163C9.description:
Assess the reasonableness of an answer in solving a multi-step word problem using mental math and estimates
strategies (including rounding)

F43BFD52338B472AB723D43BCFFD444F.description:
Interpret multi-step word problems (including problems in which remainders must be interpreted) and
determine the appropriate operations to solve

B665599ABC5F42F08346D4E6293A7735.description: Represent multi-step word problems using equations with a letter standing for the unknown quantity

3C47FBEAFE4940C28A5D125F34A799AE.description: Divide whole numbers including division with remainders

243C834EF6A24A40B2F1B21D86DD4067.description: Solve multistep word problems posed with whole numbers and having whole-number answers using the four operations, including problems in which remainders must be interpreted. Represent these problems using equations with a letter standing for the unknown quantity. Assess the reasonableness of answers using mental computation and estimation strategies including rounding.

351B876F16DF4668A497007DF339494E.description: Determine appropriate operations and solve word problems involving multiplicative comparison

99E964FE9A354586AB8648090AAA6091.description: Multiply or divide to solve word problems

991C5F3D465D448F91338D2D94703C45.description: Distinguish between multiplicative comparison and additive comparison (repeated addition)

9FFD36BF3B0E4D3C97580D6115727B74.description: Determine and use a variety of representations to model a problem involving multiplicative comparison

E5AB2E6EF2EC4BD1A31C24317861B189.description: Multiply or divide to solve word problems involving multiplicative comparison, e.g., by using drawings and equations with a symbol for the unknown number to represent the problem, distinguishing multiplicative comparison from additive comparison.

E430FE94000541639C8F6964236DA6A9.description: Represent verbal statements of multiplicative comparisons as multiplication equations

CDE1881FA17F4F2AAB388CC7F8308D0A.description: Interpret a multiplication equation as a comparison

0A428AD28036425D9047B21B4D983B8B.description: Interpret a multiplication equation as a comparison, e.g., interpret 35 = 5 × 7 as a statement that 35 is 5 times as many as 7 and 7 times as many as 5. Represent verbal statements of multiplicative comparisons as multiplication equations.

2DDD5A7DDEB2444FA83AB3753F7D8754.description: Justify the conclusions using visual models and other methods

D3EF9325DFCA4A53A67BC2F7FC6337FE.description: Record the results of comparisons with the symbols >, =, or <

CC21F25F890B438A9BD3A62B3DD47B6E.description: Compare two decimals to hundredths by reasoning about their size

517B49611BDF4E2EAF5012A4C8A1CEAC.description: Recognize that comparisons are valid only when the two decimals refer to the same whole

23D0EDA520A443F18E30D083E92E3CE9.description: Compare two decimals to hundredths by reasoning about their size. Recognize that comparisons are valid only when the two decimals refer to the same whole. Record the results of comparisons with the symbols >, =, or <, and justify the conclusions, e.g., by using a visual model.

14BC670149184D6792672004E3D739BB.description: Explain how decimals and fractions relate

E1A19685ED5D48CB9D93AB2E0CD9239F.description: Represent fractions with denominators 10 or 100 with multiple representations and decimal notation

0103692415DB4374A348016D5CABAAC5.description: Recognize multiple representations of fractions with denominators 10 and 100

5834C2F8BD6C47E5A8881060D85BCA99.description: Rename fractions with 10 and 100 in the denominator as decimals

98E4FB85411C4844BA4820BC16409118.description: Read and write decimals through hundredths

D004151459D94C9489BC7A1B26D4A5F7.description: Explain the values of digits in the decimal places

5D146CC7F1C343CB9B7AC824A86AFB19.description: Use decimal notation for fractions with denominators 10 or 100. For example, rewrite 0.62 as 62/100; describe a length as 0.62 meters; locate 0.62 on a number line diagram.

E51640706D914982A55A98C52DEB986F.description: Use knowledge of renaming tenths to hundredths to add two fractions with denominators 10 and 100

9AEC3DD8E6844670A56406732578A33F.description: Recognize that two fractions with unlike denominators can be equivalent

1780DC8ACDDE428982A00A76C67FA40C.description: Rename and recognize a fraction with a denominator of 10 as a fraction with a denominator of 100

1373C0817D374E508D1771067858F291.description: Express a fraction with denominator 10 as an equivalent fraction with denominator 100, and use this technique to add two fractions with respective denominators 10 and 100.2 For example, express 3/10 as 30/100, and add 3/10 + 4/100 = 34/100.

5EA2E572ED8E469298540CA6711C1CB4.description: Solve word problems involving multiplication of a fraction by a whole number

A6CFFC6D532B40C282D36BC9B654D356.description: Use fraction models and equations to represent the problem

CF7ABFE16C504E0AB2733A339676A4AE.description: Multiply a fraction by a whole number by using the idea that a/b is a multiple of 1/b

F701134E646348288E61484F703A0B79.description: Explain that a multiple of a/b is a multiple of 1/b (unit fraction) using a visual fraction model

63595AE71EC04AF8A7FB4CF450013EFE.description:
Apply multiplication of whole numbers to multiplication of a fraction by a whole number using visual fraction
models

8913B09AE48A450E89D18ACF9D291547.description: Multiply a fraction by a whole number

BEDAA4E2477A4D65B2E570D65D0470B0.description: Represent a fraction a/b as a multiple of 1/b (unit fractions)

8980DED71C394F81A77C4BA7A100F071.description: Apply and extend previous understandings of multiplication to multiply a fraction by a whole number.

BEC5853A68864331B978F5C2F61F3FE2.description:
Solve word problems involving addition and subtraction of fractions referring to the same whole and having like
denominators, by using visual fraction models and equations to represent the problem

A1C57EB29EAD411C8EBAA632983877DE.description: Add and subtract mixed numbers by replacing each mixed number with an equivalent fraction

8FC89E98B769409595E9D9415338055E.description:
Add and subtract mixed numbers with like denominators by using properties of operations and the relationship
between addition and subtraction

6DCBFAFAFF104C639D0DA4F543681C48.description: Add and subtract fractions with like denominators

8E8C3985872745C4BAB1708F142C7506.description: Record decompositions of fractions as an equation and explain the equation using visual fraction models

883A22DD584B4C7BB81A748655A45170.description:
Using visual fraction models, decompose a fraction into the sum of fractions with the same denominator in
more than one way

4961250092D74C46943503537DB725A2.description:
Using fraction models, reason that subtraction of fractions is separating parts that are referring to the same
whole

2CA286E9C56F41B5BA86F52C1B20F0D9.description: Using fraction models, reason that addition of fractions is joining parts that are referring to the same whole

745DD285B38346EE9F619365D39C3E9E.description: Replace improper fractions with a mixed number, using visual fraction models

D6EC42C4205F4B95BCDAF751AA3C8DAF.description: Replace mixed numbers with equivalent fractions, using visual fraction models

46902E1DD90F42F092A004129E610319.description: Recognize multiple representations of one whole using fractions with the same denominator

7E81339DD3F6403AA0A39941865E9DD0.description: Understand accumulating unit fractions (1/b) results in a fraction (a/b), where a is greater than 1

5887A76AF6404492BD60CFB4D5A0BDC3.description: Understand a fraction a/b with a > 1 as a sum of fractions 1/b.

52247D61B5B84B15B570E743BE289957.description: Justify the results of a comparison of two fractions by using a visual fraction model

3DD5B5C05A3A42BD91B16E6120C01A38.description: Compare two fractions with different numerators and denominators

4D12340D23854D2E822F2153604ECC27.description: Make comparisons based on parts of the same whole

1DE25978DEC1472196DD311242A8009E.description: Use benchmark fractions such as ½ for comparison purposes

69D3ABFC5D51497488D0221FDD4A0493.description: Recognize fractions as being greater than, less than, or equal to other fractions

BBF622EC0DBC47F88E52F2E6770227D8.description: Compare two fractions with different numerators and different denominators, e.g., by creating common denominators or numerators, or by comparing to a benchmark fraction such as 1/2. Recognize that comparisons are valid only when the two fractions refer to the same whole. Record the results of comparisons with symbols >, =, or <, and justify the conclusions, e.g., by using a visual fraction model.

BFDD7682CE5648858DD21C81145E1362.description: Generate equivalent fractions using visual fraction models and explain why they can be called “equivalent”

77FD3D0884344BE2AFF4B86840505EC1.description: Use visual fraction models to show why fractions are equivalent

5AFB58EB034842EFAFCACE2ADF6AEC5B.description:
Explain why a/b is equal to (n x a) / (n x b) by using fraction models with attention to how the number and size
of the parts differ even though the two fractions themselves are the same size

12FA20AB23454BF9A90DFE3A1F91DFF5.description: Recognize and identify equivalent fractions with unlike denominators

1D6266A27E3D4722BEB9F2DB470B0B89.description: Explain why a fraction a/b is equivalent to a fraction (n × a)/(n × b) by using visual fraction models, with attention to how the number and size of the parts differ even though the two fractions themselves are the same size. Use this principle to recognize and generate equivalent fractions.

928411709D5C48D1A9E8159A1A96BD79.description: Illustrate and explain the calculation by using written equations, rectangular arrays, and/or area models

7E1A7802276F4EB781EC08E4354F09DF.description:
Use the strategies based on place value, the properties of operations, and/or the relationship between
multiplication and division

7AAF025194DA4F819B86A53394065C20.description: Find whole number quotients and remainders with up to four-digit dividends and one-digit divisors

9859B45444CD43F6A63697808A74C41B.description: Find whole-number quotients and remainders with up to four-digit dividends and one-digit divisors, using strategies based on place value, the properties of operations, and/or the relationship between multiplication and division. Illustrate and explain the calculation by using equations, rectangular arrays, and/or area models.

ED666ACF8E804EF58539534C4C18D74D.description: Illustrate and explain calculations by using written equations, rectangular arrays, and/or area models

C141A810E9794C4DAD71E3FC7994175C.description: Use strategies based on place value and the properties of operations to multiply whole numbers

FDE218409AE74FE0AD1BD9623DCDA124.description: Multiply a whole number of up to four digits by a one-digit whole number

689EA861EA8F4E55BABD7D150A741DC4.description: Multiply a whole number of up to four digits by a one-digit whole number, and multiply two two-digit numbers, using strategies based on place value and the properties of operations. Illustrate and explain the calculation by using equations, rectangular arrays, and/or area models.

CD58B0E433BB462E8D65B7499DA41C2A.description:
Fluently add and subtract multi-digit whole numbers less than or equal to 1,000,000 using the standard
algorithm

00411C430D2642BE9ED8794091396724.description: Round multi-digit whole numbers to any place using place value

DEF20DD6E2EA43D386978E474FFEC662.description: Read and write multi-digit whole numbers using base ten numerals, number names, and expanded form

0FB905A9CACD493083C7EC8C35E4270B.description:
Compare two multi-digit numbers based on meanings of the digits in each place, using >, =, and < symbols to
record the results of comparisons

3DB413DAA1EF4CA49B60957130AF45DB.description: Read and write multi-digit whole numbers using base-ten numerals, number names, and expanded form. Compare two multi-digit numbers based on meanings of the digits in each place, using >, =, and < symbols to record the results of comparisons.

99A5F6A1517C4E6ABEF9F33F7619BE89.description:
Recognize that in a multi-digit whole number, a digit in one place represents ten times what it represents in the
place to its right

AB1A9DFB4A4841328418F9E1F3C7758B.description: NUMBER AND OPERATIONS IN BASE TEN

E621754793244D6B982773A85CE26007.description: Find an angle measure by subtracting the measurements of the smaller angle from the larger angle

B8DE238F07AE4C3F85DAAB57B8C0D3A0.description: Find an angle measure by adding the measurements of the smaller angles that make up the larger angle

F242468E57914F448A7B3AD49C1B15DC.description: Solve addition and subtraction equations to find unknown angle measurements on a diagram

56CF1DD9656548E281BD2438E967130C.description: Recognize that an angle can be divided into smaller angles

E4B3A8D0A5F7475AA7860B3FC33EE56A.description: Recognize angle measure as additive. When an angle is decomposed into non-overlapping parts, the angle measure of the whole is the sum of the angle measures of the parts. Solve addition and subtraction problems to find unknown angles on a diagram in real world and mathematical problems, e.g., by using an equation with a symbol for the unknown angle measure.

FD1B2E0F810942B68E350177849B3FA0.description: Measure angles in whole number degrees using a protractor

4F17AAFDEEAF4E0EA1D6FEB192F804D3.description: Determine the kind of angle based on the specified measure to decide reasonableness of the sketch

288AA4C5C61B4E7996EB97F7AACEE422.description: Determine which scale on the protractor to use, based on the direction the angle is open

F144757A9124499BA250477C909E35AF.description: Recognize that angles are measured in degrees (o)

A095968315FC40A5825F79604F8969F9.description: Calculate angle measurement using the 360 degrees of a circle

501D0B89CF8F4E4E9402D463AA23BF56.description: Measure angles in whole-number degrees using a protractor. Sketch angles of specified measure.

CCE23CBC1A6C4264A1A7DEB77CA9C47D.description: Compare angles to circles with the angles point at the center of the circle to determine the measure of the angle

8662B131E1EB48CA8CCAACCB0E899E7E.description: Recognize that an angle is a fraction of a 360 degree circle

C077125583C6482999D4590DCC2B5DB3.description: Explain the angle measurement in terms of degrees

34DCEF24F8044CC784139318150A2D5E.description: Recognize and identify an angle as a geometric shape formed from 2 rays with a common endpoint

B49786AD84064AFE804C6396E3C3E110.description: Recognize a circle as a geometric figure that has 360 degrees

469EF0E21FC74BBEA3F1F9331BCB35E3.description: Recognize angles as geometric shapes that are formed wherever two rays share a common endpoint, and understand concepts of angle measurement:

516F2DC77BAC428793E6533A15DCB0F7.description: Analyze and interpret a line plot to solve problems involving addition and subtraction of fractions

D4A93A8BD7BD420D93724A1E97F5E5C4.description: Make a line plot to display a data set of measurements in fractions of a unit (1/2, 1/4, 1/8). Solve problems involving addition and subtraction of fractions by using information presented in line plots. For example, from a line plot find and interpret the difference in length between the longest and shortest specimens in an insect collection.

00E2407F1560440D92D11F4040036583.description: Solve area and perimeter problems in which there is an unknown factor (n)

2DAE355E09274533911DBDCF848FA0FC.description: Apply the formula for area of a rectangle to solve real world and mathematical problems

B9142F70D19448C58B52CD38B2630805.description: Apply the formula for perimeter of a rectangle to solve real world and mathematical problems

690CACE468064A41AEFEE448C76C15AF.description: Know that the formula for the area of a rectangle is L x W

12EF12B10F0646F7B9DFF132F3000036.description: Know that the formula for the perimeter of a rectangle is 2L + 2W or L + L + W+ W

D2577C45726C495ABE53126DEE9804A2.description: Apply the area and perimeter formulas for rectangles in real world and mathematical problems. For example, find the width of a rectangular room given the area of the flooring and the length, by viewing the area formula as a multiplication equation with an unknown factor.

3432E828E3A74E139E339D38711973CC.description: Solve word problems that require expressing measurements given in a larger unit in terms of a smaller unit

D7EB1A17DE77488DA2F1F604F0786F49.description: Solve word problems involving measurement that include simple fractions or decimals

1D1FA419C0444F9F90B60EA90AAADF3A.description: Solve word problems involving distances, intervals of time, liquid volumes, masses of objects, and money

55875F8EF0B04DF3A23FA12623055F65.description: Add, subtract multiply, and divide fractions and decimals

C7DCB47A949746B4B1B76B54A7BBDD63.description:
Represent measurement quantities using diagrams such as number line diagrams that feature a measurement
scale

3D9250C7EDE943FCBF0AECECC50B49FC.description: Express measurements given in a larger unit in terms of a smaller unit

A7A7D1EEF0334F149B0525CB658BA394.description: Use the four operations to solve word problems involving distances, intervals of time, liquid volumes, masses of objects, and money, including problems involving simple fractions or decimals, and problems that require expressing measurements given in a larger unit in terms of a smaller unit. Represent measurement quantities using diagrams such as number line diagrams that feature a measurement scale.

EC5772A119CA45B68BC417C1877E3DFB.description:
Convert larger units of measurement within the same system to smaller units and record conversions in a 2-
column table

0E9511C001BD424FB35D06D013FE749B.description: Compare the different units within the same system of measurement

847849613C48401E9307CD19CC94C091.description: Know relative size of measurement units (km, m; kg, g; lb, oz; L, mL; hrs, min, sec)

E195C3696AEC47BB86E17088B90BE1EF.description: Know relative sizes of measurement units within one system of units including km, m, cm; kg, g; lb, oz.; l, ml; hr, min, sec. Within a single system of measurement, express measurements in a larger unit in terms of a smaller unit. Record measurement equivalents in a two-column table. For example, know that 1 ft is 12 times as long as 1 in. Express the length of a 4 ft snake as 48 in. Generate a conversion table for feet and inches listing the number pairs (1, 12), (2, 24), (3, 36), ...

20315E6C895B407887D2C2CEEADB96A9.description: Draw lines of symmetry for two-dimensional figures

D8A2FD793AE049D8958645F8695122E2.description: Recognize a line of symmetry as a line across a figure that when folded along creates matching parts

36FBF4A085874DC9BF8E9447A1F1BA72.description: Recognize lines of symmetry for a two-dimensional figure

949604B33DC0436996C617DFEB174454.description: Recognize a line of symmetry for a two-dimensional figure as a line across the figure such that the figure can be folded along the line into matching parts. Identify line-symmetric figures and draw lines of symmetry.

6EF12E78D854430B8D832825E814324E.description: Classify triangles as right triangles or not right

7D2F02232AFE4E4291132AE69E76DFB6.description: Classify two-dimensional figures based on parallel or perpendicular lines and size of angles

B9E836E6B8714147B32AFD7650D7C78D.description: Recognize acute, obtuse, and right angles

3CC249278E2443679E9E27FD4010C378.description: Identify parallel or perpendicular lines in two-dimensional figures

B701D56E46914E25A77E355E06BAC8D0.description: Classify two-dimensional figures based on the presence or absence of parallel or perpendicular lines, or the presence or absence of angles of a specified size. Recognize right triangles as a category, and identify right triangles.

A01A4FF248194C4380628C2782AA6845.description:
Draw points, lines, line segments, rays, angles (right, acute, obtuse), and perpendicular and parallel
lines

EE4B99332A5E424793762F80C7123DBD.description:
Analyze two-dimensional figures to identify points, lines, line segments, rays, angles, (right, acute,
obtuse), and perpendicular and parallel lines

3BAC417D2BF94282A1DCB782AF89CE44.description: Draw points, lines, line segments, rays, angles (right, acute, obtuse), and perpendicular and parallel lines. Identify these in two-dimensional figures.
